channel.title: Semiautonomous Systems
channel.description: Analysis and research on data poisoning, AI crawler enforcement, and digital accountability infrastructure.

item.title: Data Poisoning FAQ: Technical and Legal Answers
item.description: Answers to common questions about data poisoning, web crawling, robots.txt, AIPREF, legal status, and enforcement mechanisms for AI training defense.

item.title: Publisher Defenses: Cost Imposition vs Poisoning
item.description: Comparing defense strategies against AI scraping: proof-of-work systems impose costs, data poisoning degrades value. Who pays and what works for publishers.

item.title: AI Poisoning Threat Models: Backdoors and RAG
item.description: Backdoor attacks, model degradation, and RAG poisoning explained. Technical analysis of who can attack, defense costs, and power dynamics in AI training.

item.title: Defensive Data Poisoning: Ethics and Alternatives
item.description: Analyzing ethical tradeoffs of defensive data poisoning: proportionality, collateral damage, and safer alternatives like proof-of-work and AIPREF standards.

item.title: What Is Data Poisoning in Machine Learning?
item.description: Data poisoning manipulates AI training data to alter model behavior. Learn how defensive tools like Nightshade protect content from unauthorized AI training.

item.title: Why VENOM Exists: AI Data Enforcement Analysis
item.description: When robots.txt fails, enforcement mechanisms emerge. VENOM analyzes data poisoning, proof-of-work, and technical countermeasures for AI training governance.

item.title: State of Defensive Data Poisoning 2026 Report
item.description: Comprehensive analysis of AI training data enforcement: robots.txt bypass data, tool effectiveness, legal developments, and the shift from signaling to enforcement.
